learning_outcomes.description: Author programs using Functional Programming concepts, such as Algebraic Data Types and Type Classes
Use Functional Programming to achieve high levels of abstraction and program correctness
Compare and contrast programming methodologies, such as Functional Programming, Logic Programming and Procedural Programming
Apply the tools and workflows that are enabled by Functional Programming
Solve appropriate problems using Logic Programming algorithms in Haskell

assessments.task_description:
The assessment is broken into two parts:

  1. Written submission. Mainly proofs and answering theory questions. Human evaluated. Submission through GradeScope.
  2. Code submission. Haskell code automatically graded. Submission through GradeScope.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Both written and code submission is done through GradeScope.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A 100% penalty will apply after a one-hour grace period which is provisioned in case of technical issues while submitting.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This is a closed book and identity-verified examination that will be conducted on-campus and invigilated. Students are permitted a single A4 double-sided, handwritten and/or typed, crib sheet during the exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Content Lecture

Lectures on the functional programming paradigm, category theory, and haskell programming.
learning_activities.topic_description: Content Lecture Lectures on the functional programming paradigm, category theory, and haskell programming.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(03 Mar - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Guided Teaching Session

A contact hour for asking theory based questions of a casual demonstrator.
learning_activities.topic_description: Guided Teaching Session A contact hour for asking theory based questions of a casual demonstrator.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(03 Mar - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Guided Coding Sessions

Students will write solutions in Haskell to assigned problems in a supervised environment using the exercism.io platform.


Work during practical sessions are not graded and attendance is not recorded.


Work can be completed either on the laboratory computers or on a personal laptop.
learning_activities.topic_description: Guided Coding Sessions Students will write solutions in Haskell to assigned problems in a supervised environment using the exercism.io platform. Work during practical sessions are not graded and attendance is not recorded. Work can be completed either on the laboratory computers or on a personal laptop.
